August 6, 1958
Mr. Harold Hill

National Association of
14 Gregory Hall

Educational Broadcasters
7 1958
L
Dear Mr. Hill:
You were courtesy itself upon the occasion of my recent visit to
your headquarters and I want you to know how much I appreciate it.
Your willingness to remain after office hours so that we could
complete our discussion of NAEB is very much appreciated.
From your description of the activities over the years, I am sure
I gained much grist for my editorial mill and, as I intimated, I
want to plagiarize some of your actual words in the lead of the
story I will write for our Annual Report.
I have checked on the picture of a family listening to the radio
and it seems probable that I can obtain this picture from one of
the commercial photographers; therefore, I suggest that you do not
go to the trouble to have one made in Urbana. The photo just
mentioned plus the very good Hagerstown TV picture and the picto-
gram which you will have made should serve the illustrative purÂ¬
poses of the Annual Report article very well.
Again, many thanks for your kind hospitality.
Sincerely yours.
